text.content:
CHIEF COMPLAINT: fever sob
 
I have reviewed the RN Triage Note for this visit and have reconciled any 
discrepancies.
 
HPI/ROS:55 yo female C/O fever, sob.  She developed fever to 101 this am, given 
tylenol initially helped but later temp to 102. 
exam vs stabel afebrile not hypoxic on 2l oxygen
chest difficult exam secondary to habitus and difficulty getting her sitting up 
cv rr no murmur
no urinary cath
ap Would check cxr and urine and cbc and sma 6 and go from there , 
more later
dc fair
fu pc
pt ed discussed likely causes of her fever 
 
 
 
 
 
PROBLEM LIST: 
Computerized Problem List is the source for the following: 
 
1. Hyperlipidemia                                     09/22/09  PROVIDER,ONE 
2. Diabetes Mellitus Type II or unspecified, Onset    11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
00/00/05 
3. Osteopenia, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
4. Postsurgical hypothyroidism, Onset 00/00/02        11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
5. Depression, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
6. Hypertension, Onset 00/00/05                       11/09/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
 
 
Allergies: METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
 
Active and Recently Expired Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Active Outpatient Medications                          Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE (S)
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500MG     ACTIVE
       TABLET(S) BY MOUTH EVERY 8 HOURS
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE ONE-HALF TABLET BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       DAY
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 75MG SA CAP TAKE ONE CAPSULE BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       TWICE A DAY
 
MEDICATION RECONCILIATION:
  [ x ] The medication list above was reviewed with the patient at today's
       visit. I have indicated discrepancies under each medication that is
       not being taken as prescribed. Medication orders, including any
       additions or discontinuations, have been updated as appropriate, 
       and the patient now has an accurate medication list.
text.author: PROVIDER,ONEHUNDREDTWENTYNINE
